thread.title: Jacob DeGrom and Daniel Murphy Send Mets to Commanding 3-0 Series Lead
thread.title_full: Jacob DeGrom and Daniel Murphy Send Mets to Commanding 3-0 Series Lead - The New York Times

author: Tim Rohan
title: Jacob DeGrom and Daniel Murphy Send Mets to Commanding 3-0 Series Lead
text:
Sports Newsletter Get the big sports news, highlights and analysis from Times journalists, with distinctive takes on games and some behind-the-scenes surprises, delivered to your inbox every week.
CHICAGO — For a split second, everything had gone the Cubs’ way. Trevor Cahill threw a nasty knuckle curve, and the Mets rookie Michael Conforto looked fooled, swinging through strike three with two outs and a runner on third base in a 2-2 game. But the ball hit the dirt and spun away from catcher Miguel Montero glove and sped toward the backstop.
Stunned, the Wrigley Field crowd watched as Conforto reached first base and Yoenis Cespedes scored the go-ahead run in the sixth inning.
This is the Cubs’ first championship series since 2003, and they are relying on several rookies to play important roles, many of whom have not played a full season of major league baseball.
 Mets Savor Daniel Murphy’s Home-Run Streak OCT. 19, 2015 On Baseball: Welcome to Wrigley, Where the Bleachers Will Be Beckoning OCT. 20, 2015 Playoff Series Entrances Wrigleyville OCT. 20, 2015 Sports of The Times: Mets Manager Terry Collins, a Baseball Lifer, Has His Moment in the Late Sun OCT. 19, 2015 Behind Thick-Rimmed Glasses, Cubs’ Joe Maddon Takes a Rose-Colored Approach OCT. 19, 2015 The Mets, of course, are not regulars in the playoffs, either. But their roster is composed of enough veterans, so in a tense, taut affair, like it was for much of Game 3 of the National League Championship Series on Tuesday, they played calmly and scored a 5-2 win that gave them a three-games-to-none lead, putting them one win from capturing their first pennant since 2000.
Daniel Murphy, of course, and Cespedes carried the offense, with Murphy hitting his sixth home run of the postseason, and Jacob deGrom pitched seven masterful innings.
